column4: hey, i just deselected an option in compiz config settings, it was the unity one, i thought it would just delete the settings but it removed my whole desktop. can someone please help me get it back? thanks
does anyone know how to open compiz config settings manager from terminal?
once installed, type CCSM in terminal;
ok thanks. gonna reinstall then i'll do that
/usr/sbin/synaptic ==> must to be root
thanks
type : sudo aptitude install compizconfig-settings-manager
ok great thanks. that sounds better than synaptic since there are so many packages there
in Synaptic, juste type Compiz in the search box and they show you the pakage to install
ok i have it installed, how do i open it?
Type CCSM in terminal, it should work now
You don't have the menu bar on top window?
no, i don't. it said command not found again; i didn't think it'd be different cause i had it installed before
i suggest also to install compiz_fusion
Unity?
ya, it says "Some edge and key bindings of Plugin Ubuntu Unity Plugin conflict with other plugins. Do you want to resolve these conflicts?"
ok i'll go for it

i think i set the first setting properly, but not quite sure what this means: "The new value for the key binding for the action Key to put keyboard-focus on launcher in plugin Ubuntu Unity Plugin conflicts with the action Show Main Menu of the Gnome Compatibility plugin.Do you wish to disable Show Main Menu in the Gnome Compatibility plugin?"
what was your problem at the beginning?

it just said there were compatibility issues in switching back to unity, and should i ignore or resolve them. i clicked resolve and the first was about flip left disable or something. the second i think i should disable it because the "Key to put keyboard-focus on launcher in plugin..." is probably a replacement for the "main menu" am i right?
yep do it
ok great, everything's back! thank you very much!
no problem!
